pullRequest.body:

nodes.body: Are these necessary? They are special cases of `_root_.map_zero` etc.
This looks very boilerplate-y, but there are 73 other "apply_symm_apply" lemmas in Mathlib already, so it's probably necessary...
One could also have this on the other side (for `f : B → α`).
The doc-prime linter should complain here I assume?
It didn't seem to? Is this a bug?
Oh, it's been turned off thankfully :-)
Is there a reason why this is not simply `extends A ≃ₐ[R] B, A ≃ₜ B`? The fields have the same names.
It seems to work (plus the analogous change to the `...Class` below) and has the effect of not needing to separately define `ContinuousAlgEquiv.toHomeomorph`.

I see that this now triggers linter warnings. I'm a bit confused about these: why does it want a docstring for an autogenerated instance? And the second one does not say from what the lhs simpifies...
Are these possibly bugs?

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/Algebra/Algebra/Equiv): continuous algebra equivs
